title: Jonny Fa'amatuainu
text:
Jonny Fa'amatuainu (born 29 December 1983 in <a href="Auckland">Auckland</a>, <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a>) is a <a href="Samoa">Samoa</a>n <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player, who currently plays for <a href="US%20Colomiers">Colomiers</a> in the <a href="France">French</a> <a href="Pro%20D2">Pro D2</a> competition. Fa'amatuainu's position of choice is <a href="flanker%20%28rugby%29">flanker</a>, but he also plays <a href="Rugby%20union/lock">lock</a>.
Club career.
Initially, while at high school, Fa’amatuainu played <a href="basketball">basketball</a>, not rugby. In that sport, he represented <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a> at under-16 and under-18, and <a href="Samoa">Samoa</a> at under-20 age-group level. He started playing rugby relatively late, at the age of 18, when the rugby coach at his school (<a href="De%20La%20Salle%20College%2C%20Mangere%20East">De La Salle College, Mangere East</a> in <a href="Auckland">Auckland</a>) asked him to join their rugby team, because the team needed a flanker. After some hesitation, he agreed and it didn’t take long for his (international) rugby career to take off.
In January 2006, Fa’amatuainu joined <a href="Bath%20Rugby">Bath Rugby</a> in the <a href="England">English</a> <a href="Aviva%20Premiership">Aviva Premiership</a> on a short-term deal but was offered a two-year contract a few months later.
After not getting much game time during the <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20English%20Premiership%20%28rugby%20union%29">2009–10</a> season, and due to the arrival of <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a> captain <a href="Lewis%20Moody">Lewis Moody</a> and <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> <a href="Back%20row%20%28rugby%20union%29">back-rower</a> <a href="Simon%20Taylor%20%28rugby%20player%29">Simon Taylor</a> at Bath, Fa’amatuainu left Bath for the <a href="Wales">Welsh</a> club <a href="Scarlets">Scarlets</a> in the <a href="Pro14">Pro12</a> on a one-season loan for the <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Celtic%20League">2010–11</a> season.
At the end of the 2010-2011 season, Fa’amatuainu left the Scarlets when he wasn’t offered a new contract. Instead, he went to <a href="Japan">Japan</a> to play for the <a href="Coca-Cola%20Red%20Sparks">Coca-Cola West Red Sparks</a> in the <a href="Top%20League">Top League</a>. In 2013, Fa’amatuainu joined <a href="Toyota%20Industries%20Shuttles">Toyota Industries Shuttles</a> where he played until 2015.
In 2015, he signed with the French club <a href="US%20Colomiers">Colomiers</a>.
International career.
Jonny Fa'amatuainu played for the <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">Samoan Sevens</a> team during the <a href="2003-04%20World%20Sevens%20Series">2003–04</a> and <a href="2004-05%20World%20Sevens%20Series">2004–05</a> editions of the <a href="World%20Rugby%20Sevens%20Series">World Rugby Sevens Series</a>. He made his debut for the <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Samoa national team</a> in November 2005 against <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a>. He played a total of sixteen games for Samoa, his last against <a href="Tonga%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Tonga</a> in July 2011.
